DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this research is to adapt the NF-specific adult version of the Skype 3RP for use with adolescents, and to test its feasibility, acceptability, and preliminary effect in improving quality of life, and in decreasing stress and psychological distress.
DOC.brief_title: Resiliency Training for Adolescent Neurofibromatosis Patients Via Videoconferencing With Skype
DOC.criteria: 1. Must be between the ages of 12 and 17 2. Can read and speak English at or above the 6th grade level 3. Diagnosis of neurofibromatosis type 1 or neurofibromatosis type 2 by a specialized medical provider 1. Severe active or untreated major mental illness that would interfere with study participation, to be determined at the discretion of the study investigator (e.g. untreated psychosis or suicidality) 2. Recent (within past 3 months) change in antidepressant medication 3. Use of formal relaxation training (including past participation in a mindbody program), currently or in the past 6 months 4. Unable or unwilling to sign the informed consent documents 5. Unable or unwilling to participate in an intervention delivered via videoconferencing with Skype
